current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 18, United States Code, to clarify and expand Federal criminal jurisdiction over
			 Federal contractors and employees outside the United States, and for other
			 purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to limit any authority of the

This Act and the amendments made by this Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act
		or any amendment made by this Act shall be construed—

to limit or affect the application of
		ex­tra­ter­ri­tor­i­al jurisdiction related to any other Federal law; or

to limit or
		affect any authority or responsibility of a Chief of Mission as provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 207 of the Foreign Service Act of 1980

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act or any amendment made by this
		Act shall apply to the authorized intelligence activities of the United
		States Government.
